channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Detection, Pose Estimation and Segmentation for Multiple Bodies: Closing the Virtuous Circle
item.description: We condition pose estimation model by segmentation masks instead of bounding boxes to improve instance separation.

item.title: Detection, Pose Estimation and Segmentation for Multiple Bodies: Closing the Virtuous Circle
item.description: We condition pose estimation model by segmentation masks instead of bounding boxes to improve instance separation.

item.title: VideoLights: Feature Refinement and Cross-Task Alignment Transformer for Joint Video Highlight Detection and Moment Retrieval
item.description: Video Highlight Detection and Moment Retrieval (HD/MR) are essential in video analysis.

item.title: CellSeg1: Robust Cell Segmentation with One Training Image
item.description: We introduce CellSeg1, a practical solution for segmenting cells of arbitrary morphology and modality with a few dozen cell annotations in 1 image.

item.title: TextSSR: Diffusion-based Data Synthesis for Scene Text Recognition
item.description: Experiments show that models trained on added TextSSR-F data exhibit better accuracy compared to models trained on 4 million existing synthetic data.

item.title: R-Bot: An LLM-based Query Rewrite System
item.description: Query rewrite is essential for optimizing SQL queries to improve their execution efficiency without changing their results.

item.title: How Much Can Time-related Features Enhance Time Series Forecasting?
item.description: Recent advancements in long-term time series forecasting (LTSF) have primarily focused on capturing cross-time and cross-variate (channel) dependencies within historical data.

item.title: Pluggable Style Representation Learning for Multi-Style Transfer
item.description: Specifically, for style modeling, we propose a style representation learning scheme to encode the style information into a compact representation.

item.title: A Comprehensive Guide to Explainable AI: From Classical Models to LLMs
item.description: Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) addresses the growing need for transparency and interpretability in AI systems, enabling trust and accountability in decision-making processes.

item.title: Automatic Differentiation-based Full Waveform Inversion with Flexible Workflows
item.description: The AD-based framework not only includes forword modeling and associated gradient computations for wave equations in various types of media from isotropic acoustic to vertically or horizontally transverse isotropic elastic, but also incorporates a suite of objective functions, regularization techniques, and optimization algorithms.

item.title: Wafer2Spike: Spiking Neural Network for Wafer Map Pattern Classification
item.description: In integrated circuit design, the analysis of wafer map patterns is critical to improve yield and detect manufacturing issues.

item.title: MAFcounter: An efficient tool for counting the occurrences of k-mers in MAF files
item.description: MAFcounter is multithreaded, fast, and memory efficient, enabling k-mer counting in DNA and protein sequence alignment files.

item.title: Handling irresolvable conflicts in the Semantic Web: an RDF-based conflict-tolerant version of the Deontic Traditional Scheme
item.description: This paper presents a new ontology that implements the well-known Deontic Traditional Scheme in RDFs and SPARQL, fit to handle irresolvable conflicts, i. e., situations in which two or more statements prescribe conflicting obligations, prohibitions, or permissions, with none of them being "stronger" than the other one(s).

item.title: MCUCoder: Adaptive Bitrate Learned Video Compression for IoT Devices
item.description: The rapid growth of camera-based IoT devices demands the need for efficient video compression, particularly for edge applications where devices face hardware constraints, often with only 1 or 2 MB of RAM and unstable internet connections.

item.title: LLM Teacher-Student Framework for Text Classification With No Manually Annotated Data: A Case Study in IPTC News Topic Classification
item.description: To address this challenge, we propose a teacher-student framework based on large language models (LLMs) for developing multilingual news classification models of reasonable size with no need for manual data annotation.

item.title: Contextual Checkerboard Denoise -- A Novel Neural Network-Based Approach for Classification-Aware OCT Image Denoising
item.description: In contrast to non-medical image denoising, where enhancing image clarity is the primary goal, medical image denoising warrants preservation of crucial features without introduction of new artifacts.

item.title: Truth or Mirage? Towards End-to-End Factuality Evaluation with LLM-Oasis
item.description: After the introduction of Large Language Models (LLMs), there have been substantial improvements in the performance of Natural Language Generation (NLG) tasks, including Text Summarization and Machine Translation.

item.title: ContextGNN: Beyond Two-Tower Recommendation Systems
item.description: Recommendation systems predominantly utilize two-tower architectures, which evaluate user-item rankings through the inner product of their respective embeddings.

item.title: GuardSplat: Efficient and Robust Watermarking for 3D Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Specifically, 1) We first propose a CLIP-guided Message Decoupling Optimization module for training the message decoder, leveraging CLIP's aligning capability and rich representations to achieve a high extraction accuracy with minimal optimization costs, presenting exceptional capability and efficiency.

item.title: A Simple Sparse Matrix Vector Multiplication Approach to Padded Convolution
item.description: We introduce an algorithm for efficiently representing convolution with zero-padding and stride as a sparse transformation matrix, applied to a vectorized input through sparse matrix-vector multiplication (SpMV).

item.title: Can Large Language Models Reason about the Region Connection Calculus?
item.description: Qualitative Spatial Reasoning is a well explored area of Knowledge Representation and Reasoning and has multiple applications ranging from Geographical Information Systems to Robotics and Computer Vision.

item.title: T2Vid: Translating Long Text into Multi-Image is the Catalyst for Video-LLMs
item.description: In this work, our study of these approaches harvests an effective data augmentation method.

item.title: ChineseWebText 2.0: Large-Scale High-quality Chinese Web Text with Multi-dimensional and fine-grained information
item.description: With this approach, we release the largest, high-quality and fine-grained Chinese text ChineseWebText2. 0, which consists of 3. 8TB and each text is associated with a quality score, domain labels, a toxicity label and a toxicity score, facilitating the LLM researchers to select data based on various types of fine-grained information.

item.title: Multimodal Whole Slide Foundation Model for Pathology
item.description: The field of computational pathology has been transformed with recent advances in foundation models that encode histopathology region-of-interests (ROIs) into versatile and transferable feature representations via self-supervised learning (SSL).

item.title: Dual Risk Minimization: Towards Next-Level Robustness in Fine-tuning Zero-Shot Models
item.description: Fine-tuning foundation models often compromises their robustness to distribution shifts.

item.title: Scaling Transformers for Low-Bitrate High-Quality Speech Coding
item.description: The tokenization of speech with neural audio codec models is a vital part of modern AI pipelines for the generation or understanding of speech, alone or in a multimodal context.

item.title: A Multi-Loss Strategy for Vehicle Trajectory Prediction: Combining Off-Road, Diversity, and Directional Consistency Losses
item.description: Trajectory prediction is essential for the safety and efficiency of planning in autonomous vehicles.

item.title: ICPR 2024 Competition on Multilingual Claim-Span Identification
item.description: A lot of claims are made in social media posts, which may contain misinformation or fake news.

item.title: Fast Mutual Information Computation for Large Binary Datasets
item.description: Mutual Information (MI) is a powerful statistical measure that quantifies shared information between random variables, particularly valuable in high-dimensional data analysis across fields like genomics, natural language processing, and network science.

item.title: Another look at inference after prediction
item.description: Our extensive theoretical and numerical analyses indicate that the Chen and Chen (CC) estimator offers a balance between robustness to ML model specification and statistical efficiency, making it the preferred choice for use in practice.

item.title: Beyond Surface Structure: A Causal Assessment of LLMs' Comprehension Ability
item.description: We further apply the ADCE to evaluate a series of mainstream LLMs, showing that most of them exhibit deep structure comprehension ability, which grows along with the prediction accuracy.

item.title: LDA-AQU: Adaptive Query-guided Upsampling via Local Deformable Attention
item.description: Therefore, we introduce local self-attention into the upsampling task and demonstrate that the majority of existing upsamplers can be regarded as special cases of upsamplers based on local self-attention.

item.title: Ensemble Watermarks for Large Language Models
item.description: Concretely, we combine acrostica and sensorimotor norms with the established red-green watermark to achieve a 98% detection rate.

item.title: DeMo: Decoupled Momentum Optimization
item.description: Training large neural networks typically requires sharing gradients between accelerators through specialized high-speed interconnects.

item.title: Classical and Quantum Algorithms for the Deterministic L-system Inductive Inference Problem
item.description: It would be significant if this could be done automatically from data, such as from sequences of images.

item.title: Initialization using Update Approximation is a Silver Bullet for Extremely Efficient Low-Rank Fine-Tuning
item.description: Low-rank adapters have become a standard approach for efficiently fine-tuning large language models (LLMs), but they often fall short of achieving the performance of full fine-tuning.

item.title: ForgerySleuth: Empowering Multimodal Large Language Models for Image Manipulation Detection
item.description: Moreover, we construct the ForgeryAnalysis dataset through the Chain-of-Clues prompt, which includes analysis and reasoning text to upgrade the image manipulation detection task.

item.title: CAREL: Instruction-guided reinforcement learning with cross-modal auxiliary objectives
item.description: Grounding the instruction in the environment is a key step in solving language-guided goal-reaching reinforcement learning problems.

item.title: Adaptive Interactive Segmentation for Multimodal Medical Imaging via Selection Engine
item.description: To mitigate memory bottlenecks and optimize prompt frame selection during the inference of 2D image sequences, we developed an automated system, the Adaptive Frame Selection Engine (AFSE).

item.title: Graph Neural Networks for Heart Failure Prediction on an EHR-Based Patient Similarity Graph
item.description: Although the Random Forest (RF) baseline achieved a similar AUPRC value, the GT model offered enhanced interpretability due to the use of patient relationships in the graph structure.

item.title: Uniform Attention Maps: Boosting Image Fidelity in Reconstruction and Editing
item.description: This study underscores the potential of uniform attention maps to enhance the fidelity and versatility of diffusion-based image processing methods.

item.title: Feedback-driven object detection and iterative model improvement
item.description: In this paper, we present the development and evaluation of a platform designed to interactively improve object detection models.

item.title: Accelerating Multimodal Large Language Models via Dynamic Visual-Token Exit and the Empirical Findings
item.description: In particular, we reveal that visual tokens will stop contributing to reasoning when the text tokens receive enough image information, yielding obvious visual redundancy.

item.title: AIDetx: a compression-based method for identification of machine-learning generated text
item.description: This paper introduces AIDetx, a novel method for detecting machine-generated text using data compression techniques.

item.title: Cross-Domain Recommendation Meets Large Language Models
item.description: Cross-domain recommendation (CDR) has emerged as a promising solution to the cold-start problem, faced by single-domain recommender systems.

item.title: DELT: A Simple Diversity-driven EarlyLate Training for Dataset Distillation
item.description: The conventional batch-to-batch matching mechanism is ideal for small-scale datasets and includes bi-level optimization methods on models and syntheses, such as FRePo, RCIG, and RaT-BPTT, as well as other methods like distribution matching, gradient matching, and weight trajectory matching.

item.title: Enhanced anomaly detection in well log data through the application of ensemble GANs
item.description: This study extends the ensemble GANs (EGANs) framework to capture the distribution of well log data and detect anomalies that fall outside of these distributions.

item.title: Auto-RAG: Autonomous Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Large Language Models
item.description: Iterative retrieval refers to the process in which the model continuously queries the retriever during generation to enhance the relevance of the retrieved knowledge, thereby improving the performance of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).

item.title: SURE-VQA: Systematic Understanding of Robustness Evaluation in Medical VQA Tasks
item.description: Vision-Language Models (VLMs) have great potential in medical tasks, like Visual Question Answering (VQA), where they could act as interactive assistants for both patients and clinicians.

item.title: Learning Visual Abstract Reasoning through Dual-Stream Networks
item.description: Visual abstract reasoning tasks present challenges for deep neural networks, exposing limitations in their capabilities.
